page.title: 11COSHESTON - OLD INDUSTRIES
page.content: Nowadays most people who live in Cosheston work at the oil refineries or power station. Most of them are quite well off. 80 years ago it was very different. Most of the villagers worked on the land and many of them were poor. Most people worked on farms. A lot of horse training went on in the area and some men worked at felling trees. Others worked at rope making and stone quarrying at Cosheston Reaches. A lot of lime burning went on and there are old lime kilns still to be seen today. There were lime kilns and quarries at Lower Nash, too. There was a small boatbuilding yard at Carton's Shipyard at The Bank, Cosheston, and some men from the village travelled to work at the big Royal Dockyard at Pembroke Dock.
